result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Ray Leonard Lacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  DOC to collect monetary amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Restitution set at zero.

Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 16 months of the incarceration.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with time now being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or illegally controlled substances
AODA, programs or treatment as recommended.  Random screening.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant:   he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay DNA surcharge; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety By Use of a Dangerous Weapon (Pointing)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Ray Leonard Lacy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (44 pages)  PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing JULY 16, 2014, received and filed.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 48 months with 239 days credit -  concurrent with time now being served - INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 24 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 24 months; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) no alcohol or illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening; 6) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 16 months of the incarceration. 

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds;
- restitution is set at -0-.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as amended in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Justin Ray Leonard Lacy in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Justin Ray Leonard Lacy in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the State, Court orders the penalty enhancer "Repeater" is DISMISSED in Count 1.

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Justin Ray Leonard Lacy not in court, in custody.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin Ray Leonard Lacy in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Justin Ray Leonard Lacy in custody.  Paul Hauer for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Zielinski-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding Dane County case #11CF409 that are attached to the complaint.  Also sworn for the state:Keith Miller-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Justin Ray Leonard Lacy not in court, in custody.    Marissa Santiago for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was NOT produced from Dane County.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing this date.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Majado A

Defendant Justin Ray Leonard Lacy in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Justin Ray Leonard Lacy in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Court ordered charging portion of Criminal Complaint as to Count 1 amended to read "by not more than 4 years."  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  No plea entered as to Count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
